pros: Small environment, friendly people, cool vibe
cons: Little pay, no benefits, few hours

review_title: It's a good place to work.
job_title: Student Theater Technician in Beloit, WI
pros: The people were great, the work is really enjoyable, management is fantastic.
cons: The space fully sucks-- it was built in the 70s and hasn't been maintained by the college especially well.

pros: Great Students and for most part friendly staff and faculty.
cons: This college institution thrives on calling itself an inclusive and equitable campus. It is far from the truth. The "Becoming Better" initiative only applies to certain minority groups. There is total disregard for brown bodies that work there, the treatment they receive is horrible. It's like a revolving door, people don't stay in their jobs because of the work culture and really, bad, bad pay. The Deans office is the worst, totally incompetent. Constantly recycling positions to fill others on campus. This was once a great college to work for, now it is one of the worst in the Midwest. Top management have no appreciation for staff and pat themselves on the back. They allow themselves to work from home but not their department staff.

pros: Good experience and a great opportunity to learn
cons: None really except the pay.

pros: Great people who care a lot about student development.
cons: Pay is well below average.

review_title: Great benefits and time off - really low pay
pros: Lots of time off during the year for holidays, winter and spring break. Enjoyed being on a small college campus. Benefits available (pro-rated) for part time work.
cons: Really low pay; especially in "grant funded" positions. Often, the pay cannot change during the term of the grant. That means five years without an increase.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Easy to get to and from job
cons: Everything else. Beloit college is terrifying

job_title: Director of Residential Life in Beloit, WI
pros: The people. The location. Some of the perks of working for a private school.
cons: The financial situation of the school is very limeting.

review_title: Won't get paid a lot, but the people are great
job_title: Director of Recreation and Community Services in Beloit, WI
pros: Great people to work with and a wonderful place for those who love to impact student lives.
cons: Low salaries and minimal cost of living adjustments.

pros: Easy to work, good co-workers
cons: low pay, fewer teaching options

pros: its alright if you really need a job on campus
cons: it could be better, they could pay higher

pros: Really nothing much to add
cons: Remote and small place to work and live

pros: Kitchen Skill, Flexible Hours, Tolerance, Friendliness, Lots of Hours, Cook your own Food
cons: Minimum wage, no future pay raises, clearly unsustainable at times, too much meat

pros: The staff and faculty are wonderful to work with. People are always looking to help others both personally and professionally. The campus is beautiful and the students are very passionate in just about everything. The culture is very relaxed. Salaried 12 month positions usually get ~24 days off a year. This includes sick and vacation time. Another benefit is "Winter Break", all employees receive off between December 25- January 1st, termed "Winter Break". Different departments put on programs that help benefit other staff and faculty members as well as the Beloit Community such as: Athletics offers a night for parents to drop their kids off at the campus gymnasium for a small fee, the Wellness Committee puts on programs such as Beloit Colleges Biggest Loser, walking programs, and 2-5K Walk / Run events.
cons: There are many opportunities to take on new roles and responsibilities, however there is a lack of salary compensation when new roles and titles are assumed. One of the positive aspects of Beloit College is its relaxed atmosphere, therefore one of the downsides to that is many times this get done last minute and everyone just focues on the fact that it got done. In addition to that, you often do not know what you are expected to do until the day of or a few minutes before. Being able to roll with whatever comes along is important at this college.

pros: Nice People! You enjoy your work
cons: Nothing, everything was great! I worked as a student worker

pros: Welcoming community for people of all identities
cons: Very small town with not a lot of activity

pros: There are a lot of available opportunities
cons: The pay could be better

review_title: Great place to work, very rewarding
job_title: Former Campus Safety/Security Officer in Beloit, WI
pros: Great atmosphere, outstanding co-workers, lots of experience to gain. Very rewarding, especially when the results of your actions are obviously life changing events for those involved. I'll always remember my time there fondly and highly recommended it to anyone considering employment there.
cons: Typical bureaucracy found in any university or college or corporation. Those passing down policies and procedures to the Department don't always understand that what looks good to them on paper can not always work in practice.

job_title: IT Student Worker in Beloit, WI
pros: The staff is very easy to get along with and I never butted heads with anyone during my time there as an IT worker.  The pay was average for what one would expect as a student worker.  Hours were flexible and employers were understanding when hours needed to be switched.  As an extra bonus the buildings and the campus itself is beautiful and small in size.
cons: I would have liked the pay to be a little more, but then again I was only a part-time student worker.  If one is working as a student worker they will usually push the more physically-demanding jobs onto you, at least in the IT department.

pros:
-It was better than being on the ground crew (air conditioning)
-It was full time (which is more than you can say about most jobs on campus)
-Everyone was nice to work with
cons:
-Training is nil
-Can get kind of repetitive
-They put you on meaningless, boring tasks when they run out of stuff for you to do

pros: The school is small, which allows generous opportunity to get to know professors and classmates, everyone knows each other and has enough personal attention to ask question, explore different career track, and grow personally.
cons: life style can be slow at times, there’s not a lot to do in the Beloit area.

pros: Good hours, pays better than most campus job. Gives you relevant skills for your resume. You get to sit a desk and feel important.
cons: The woman who runs the office is terrible. Her focus should be accommodating students with disabilities. This is not her priority.

review_title: Great place to work, but long hours
job_title: Assistant Track and Field Coach in Beloit, WI
pros: Caring environment, very personal, easy communication, lots of training
cons: Didn't get to schedule own hours, and those hours were often long

job_title: Library Tech Help Desk in Beloit, WI
pros: The people are quite wonderful, and depending on your job you'll be able to do your homework while you work, especially if you're not working in food service!
cons: Student employees make very close to minimum wage regardless of whether they're cleaning toilets or coding the website. That's just plain wrong.

pros: Really great group of people. Good opportunities to learn.
cons: Would have been better if there was more room to grow within work study assignments.

pros: Flexible, great liberal arts focus, a lot of student contact.
cons: Low paying and lack of benefits for younger professionals.

pros: Wonderful staff, great leadership, solid benefits, salary increases each year. Lots of flexibility and work-life balance getting better.
cons: Salary increases minimal. Benefit charges are really high.
